en-US.summary: "Blackburrow Tales" contains a series of short horror stories controlled by you. You make all of the character's key decisions throughout the story.
en-US.name: Blackburrow Tales
en-US.description:
"Blackburrow Tales" is a mature game. Please be mindful of those around you. 

"Blackburrow Tales" contains a series of short horror stories controlled by you. You make all of the character's key decisions throughout the story.
Will the main character perish, or will they stand against evil? You decide. 

Each story has multiple endings. We recommend you use a piece of paper to keep track of the different story arcs. That will allow you to achieve your desired ending.

-----------------
Useful Phrases
-----------------

For a brief tutorial, say "tutorial".

The following are useful phrases for the tale "Full Moon"
- let's play full moon
- go to location
- read case file
- scope it out
- wait until full moon
- chase it
- shoot the beast
- go to camp
- tell the chief
- go to tavern
- claw marks
- notify chief
- run

Additionally, if you receive a message stating you have not reached that portion of the game, try to say your phrase differently. 


Additional skills from Liberation studios:

"Everybody Drinks" - Full of classic party games
"Options Trading Teacher" - Learn how to trade U.S stock options
"Daily Business Quote" - Daily quotes from business titans

Credits:
Thanks to zapsplat for the audio and a big thanks to Gustavo for the art work!

publishingInformation.testingInstructions:
- Open the skill by saying "open blackburrow tales"
- List tales by saying "list tales"
- Start a tale by saying "let's play *tale name*"
- Each story component ends with a sentence describing specific actions you can take. You can say things like "read case file" or "go to location". I added a lsit to the description section.
- Each section has a re-prompt that will trigger after 8 seconds. If the user says nothing, the skill will end. 
- The entire story consists of a series of IF statements. I have added else statements to stop people from skipping ahead in the story.

en-US.privacyPolicyUrl: removed since the site is no longer available
